overall_plan_population.description: Children and youth at imminent risk of entering foster care (as determined by individualized assessment), including those in voluntary or court-ordered Family Maintenance cases, probation minors at imminent risk, children whose guardianship or adoption arrangement is at risk of disruption, children with substantiated or inconclusive child abuse/neglect allegations, children with siblings in foster care, children exposed to domestic violence, children whose caretakers have a substance use disorder, substance-exposed newborns, trafficked children, LGBTQ children, homeless youth, and pregnant and parenting youth in foster care, as well as their parents or kin caregivers. AI/AN children and their families may also be served.

program_populations.target_population: Young, first-time, low-income mothers beginning early in their pregnancy until the child turns two; first-time parents/caregivers with a child under 2 years of age
Parents/caregivers with children aged Birth to kindergarten
Families enrolled within the first three months of birth but before the child(ren) turn 24 months of age, including families referred through child welfare
Families (those with children ages 2-17) potentially including parenting youth
California families receiving Family Maintenance services or those with multiple child welfare referrals

program_populations.program_name: Motivational Interviewing for Substance Use Treatment
program_populations.target_population: Adults with children of any age
Adolescents aged 11-18 and their parent/caregivers; probation minors, homeless/runaway children, and teens demonstrating behavioral issues
Children aged 12-17 and their parents/caregivers; troubled youth and their families
